#Text=Wikinews interviews specialists on South Korea military parade
#Text=Sunday , October 6 , 2013
#Text=File photo of South Korean military troops .
#Text=Image : US Military .
#Text=On Tuesday , South Korea staged a huge military parade to mark its armed forces ' 65th anniversary in a display of long-range missiles considered a direct threat to North Korea .
#Text=11,000 troops and 190 different weapons systems were on display in the parade .
#Text=Wikinews interviewed several specialists about the parade 's possible significance .
#Text=Interviewees
#Text=Wikinews interviewed :
#Text=Robert Kelly , Associate Professor of International Relations Pusan National University ( PNU ) in South Korea
#Text=Margaret Kosal , Assistant Professor at the Sam Nunn School of International Affairs at the Georgia Institute of Technology in Atlanta , Georgia
#Text=Gari Ledyard , Professor Emeritus of Korean Studies at Columbia University , New York
#Text=Sue Mi Terry , Senior Research Scholar at the Weatherhead East Asian Institute , Columbia University in New York
#Text=Young-hae Chi , Instructor in Korean at the University of Oxford , England
#Text=Seungkwon You , Associate Teaching Professor of Korean Studies at the University of Missouri
#Text=Wikinews Q&A
#Text=File : Robert Kelly
#Text=File Photo . JPG
#Text=File photo of interviewee Robert Kelly .
#Text=Image : Robert Kelly .
#Text=( Image missing from commons : image ; log )
#Text=What is your job role ?
#Text=I am a Professor of International Relations at PNU .
#Text=I am an Assistant Professor in the Sam Nunn School of International Affairs at the Georgia Institute of Technology , more commonly known as " Georgia Tech . "

column1: #Text=I also direct the Emerging Technology and Security Program and the Biological and Chemical Nonproliferation and Counterterrorism Program .
#Text=I retired from my professorship at Columbia thirteen years ago ; since then I 've had no role .
#Text=When I was active there since 1964 , I taught Korean history and culture , emphasizing the traditional periods of Korea 's earlier history .
#Text=In those years I wrote a few articles on contemporary political issues but my research has been almost all in Korea 's past .
#Text=I am a Senior Research Scholar at Columbia University 's Weatherhead East Asian Institute .
#Text=I have been teaching Korean studies at Oxford University .
#Text=I am specialized in international relations of the Far East and particularly North Korean human rights and refugee issues .
#Text=I worked as an analyst of security issues at the Korea Institute for Defence Analyses in Seoul between 1983 and 1988 authoring a number of policy papers for the South Korean Government .
#Text=Associate Teaching Professor of Korean Studies teaching Korean Unification , Korean film , Korean society [ at the University of Missouri ] .
#Text=Is the display of cruise missiles and other weapons in a military parade by South Korea in direct response to repeated similar North Korean parades ?
#Text=Yes .
#Text=I do n't actually think these sorts of demonstrations are proper in a democracy .
#Text=Liberal states should not really be flashing their hardware in a strutting , provocative way like this .
#Text=This is the sort of thing Putin would do .
#Text=But SK 's [ South Korea 's ] case is rather exceptional .
#Text=NK [ North Korea ] tries pretty regularly to bully SK , and as its nuclear and missile programs advance , SK deterrence become ever more important .
#Text=So parades like this are a way of SK saying ' do n't mess with us even though you have nukes . '
